it is in ubuntu settings: it tells me it is laptop mode
you can use an xorg.conf to set the res
its not there by default but if you make one it will be obeyed
you will need to run:  gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf    to get write access
1024x768 should be big enough for a virtual system
yes, when you click save the file will be created with the text you set
then change the res in the file.
